ETYMOLOGY: From French sardine, from Latin sardina (or sarda), referring to the island of Sardinia, near which these fish were found in abundance.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A small, oily, edible fish of the herring family, often canned in oil or brine. Also, refers to the contents of such a can.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 沙丁鱼；一种小型的油性可食用鱼，属于鲱鱼科，常被制成罐头。也可指罐头中的沙丁鱼。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She often eats sardines on toast for a quick, healthy lunch.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她经常吃烤面包上的沙丁鱼作为快捷健康的午餐。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Used figuratively, especially in the idiom "packed like sardines," to describe people or things crowded together in a very confined space.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （比喻用法）尤其用于习语“像沙丁鱼一样挤在一起”，形容人或物被极度拥挤地塞在一个狭小的空间里。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The subway car was packed like sardines during rush hour, making it hard to breathe.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 高峰时段的地铁车厢里挤得像沙丁鱼罐头，让人呼吸困难。
